intro: Solanum stuckertii, commonly known as the Stuckert's nightshade, is a species of flowering plant in the nightshade family, Solanaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it grows in rocky and arid environments. The plant is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to purple, and its hairy, glandular leaves. Solanum stuckertii is an annual or biennial herb that typically reaches a height of about 30 centimeters. It produces small, spherical berries that contain the toxic alkaloids typical of the Solanaceae family.
